ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: If you put the time in you will learn a TON

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The work you get done on your thesis depends on you and your advisor! There's no real structure provided beyond what you set up with them - so know yourself and how you work.
Maybe a little bit more contact with the DUS

The Humanities major should consider implementing a small paper deadline in the first semester for year long thesis writers. History does this and I believe it keeps students more organized going into second semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: To work on a senior thesis is very rewarding! It's a great, rare chance to fully commit to an independent intellectual project.
It's a requirement for the major, but yes.

I would definitely recommend the year-long thesis option to Humanities students! It's an excellent chance to learn how to conduct research on your own and keep yourself organized throughout the term while pursuing a single question with extreme depth.
